titleText: Microsoft is bringing one of Apple's best features to Windows 10 with a new web browser for phones
mainText: If you're living your best Apple life, you probably know all about Handoff — a feature that lets you easily open your iPhone's active browser tab or document on your Mac, and vice versa. Now, Microsoft.

titleText: Microsoft is bringing new Edge apps to iOS, Android
mainText: Microsoft is taking the next step in its quest to try to keep Windows PCs relevant by bringing Edge to iOS and Android. Microsoft isn't doing this in the way many had thought it might. The.

titleText: Windows XP users: Your last supported refuge in Firefox ends in 2018, says Mozilla
mainText: Firefox-maker Mozilla is finally pulling the plug on support for Windows XP and Vista, removing the last remaining supported browser for the old operating systems. Firefox 52, released earlier this year, was the last fully supported.

titleText: Why Microsoft thinks customization is the secret to a better Xbox One dashboard design
mainText: Microsoft’s broader Xbox strategy for the last few years has involved a strong focus on hardware, resulting in last year’s cheaper Xbox One S and the upcoming release next month of the more powerful Xbox.

titleText: Microsoft adds support for Java to its Azure Functions serverless service
Microsoft, Machine Learning, And 'Data Wrangling': ML Leverages Business Intelligence For B2B
mainText: David A. Teich , Contributor “Data wrangling” was an interesting phrase to hear in the machine learning (ML) presentations at Microsoft Ignite. Interesting because data wrangling is from business intelligence (BI), not from artificial intelligence.
